channel.title: Should I Get This
channel.description:
i am planning on getting this laptop,
not much for gaming, but for school work, minor photoshop stuff, and for teaching (using powerpoint)
its about $1099.99 and its a "HP TouchSmart 12.1" Intel Core 2 Duo SU7300 1.3GHz Tablet PC"
[img]http://www.futureshop.ca/multimedia/Products/250x250/101/10138/10138071.jpg[/img]
specs [code]
The possibilities are endless with the versatile HP TouchSmart tm2 tablet PC, which lets you twist the screen and write or draw on it with a digital pen, navigate with your finger, or type on the keyboard. It's also equipped with Intel Core 2 Duo processing, HDMI connectivity, and wireless N connectivity for optimal un-tethered performance.

item.title: Should I Get This
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

i am gona get this but people are saying to wait, cause they sayin there are gona be better and cheaper ones, due to stability of windows 7 for tablet (not to mention vista)

Read full topic

item.title: Should I Get This
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Teh Spede, post:10, topic:338082”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=434479.msg3190874#msg3190874 date=1272232596]

jesus no, wait for microsoft’s courier

you mean wait 1-2 years? not to mention the courier is different and serves a different purpose from a tablet pc

tbh i would get the lenovo tablet

“but for school work, minor photoshop stuff,”

courier is perfect for that…
[/quote]So is any normal laptop.[/quote]
no

Read full topic

item.title: Should I Get This
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

eczema3:

Nobody needs a laptop with specs like that for school work, definitely not at $1,000.

what do you say a modest price is?

i had laptops that were cheap and had alot of problems with it. and i kinda like this one, and the specs aren’t that great.

Read full topic
